title: Braid graphs in simply-laced triangle-free Coxeter systems are median
authors: Jillian Barnes, Jadyn V. Breland, Dana C. Ernst, Ruth Perry
abstract:
Any two reduced expressions for the same Coxeter group element are related by
a sequence of commutation and braid moves. Two reduced expressions are said to
be braid equivalent if they are related via a sequence of braid moves. Braid
equivalence is an equivalence relation and the corresponding equivalence
classes are called braid classes. Each braid class can be encoded in terms of a
braid graph in a natural way. In a recent paper, Awik et al.~proved that when a
Coxeter system is simply laced and triangle free (i.e., the corresponding
Coxeter graph has no three-cycles), the braid graph for a reduced expression is
a partial cube (i.e., isometric to a subgraph of a hypercube). In this paper,
we will provide an alternate proof of this fact, as well as determine the
minimal dimension hypercube into which a braid graph can be isometrically
embedded, which addresses an open question posed by Awik et al. For our main
result, we prove that braid graphs in simply-laced triangle-free Coxeter
systems are median, which is a strengthening of previous results.
